==Events==
*[[332]] &ndash; [[Constantine the Great]] announced free distributions of food to the citizens in [[Constantinople]].
*[[1152]] &ndash; [[Henry II of England]] marries [[Eleanor of Aquitaine]].
*[[1268]] &ndash; The [[Principality of Antioch]], a [[crusader states|crusader state]], falls to the [[Mamluk Sultanate (Cairo)|Mamluk]] [[Sultan]] [[Baibars]] in the [[Siege of Antioch (1268)|Siege of Antioch]].
*[[1302]] &ndash; [[Bruges Matins (massacre)|Bruges Matins]], the nocturnal massacre of the French garrison in [[Bruges]] by members of the local [[Flanders|Flemish]] militia.
*[[1388]] &ndash; During the [[Battle of Buyur Lake]], General [[Lan Yu (general)|Lan Yu]] led a Chinese army forward to crush the Mongol hordes of [[Tögüs Temür]], the Khan of Northern Yuan.
*[[1499]] &ndash; [[Alonso de Ojeda]] sets sail from [[Cádiz]] on his voyage to what is now [[Venezuela]].
*[[1565]] &ndash; The [[Great Siege of Malta]] begins, in which [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] forces attempt and fail to conquer [[Malta]].
*1565 &ndash; The [[Royal Audiencia of Concepción]] is created by a decree of [[Philip II of Spain]].
*[[1593]] &ndash; Playwright [[Thomas Kyd]]'s accusations of [[Christian heresy|heresy]] lead to an arrest warrant for [[Christopher Marlowe]].
*[[1631]] &ndash; In [[Dorchester, Massachusetts]], [[John Winthrop]] takes the oath of office and becomes the first [[Governor of Massachusetts]].
*[[1652]] &ndash; [[Rhode Island]] passes the first law in English-speaking North America making [[slavery]] illegal.
*[[1756]] &ndash; The [[Seven Years' War]] begins when Great Britain declares war on France.
*[[1763]] &ndash; Fire destroys a large part of [[Montreal]]
*[[1783]] &ndash; First [[United Empire Loyalists]] reach Parrtown (later called [[Saint John, New Brunswick|Saint John]]), [[New Brunswick]], Canada after leaving the United States. 
*[[1803]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: The United Kingdom revokes the [[Treaty of Amiens]] and declares war on France.
*[[1804]] &ndash; [[Napoleon|Napoleon Bonaparte]] is proclaimed [[Emperor of the French]] by the [[French Senate]].
*[[1811]] &ndash; [[Battle of Las Piedras (1811)|Battle of Las Piedras]]: The first great military triumph of the revolution of the [[Río de la Plata]] in [[Uruguay]] led by [[José Artigas]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[John Bellingham]] is found guilty and sentenced to death by hanging for the assassination of  [[British Prime Minister]] [[Spencer Perceval]].
*[[1843]] &ndash; The [[Disruption of 1843|Disruption]] in [[Edinburgh]] of the [[Free Church of Scotland (1843–1900)|Free Church of Scotland]] from the [[Church of Scotland]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; Opening of the first German [[National Assembly]] ([[Frankfurt Parliament|Nationalversammlung]]) in [[Frankfurt]], Germany.
*[[1860]] &ndash; [[Abraham Lincoln]] wins the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]] presidential nomination over [[William H. Seward]], who later becomes the [[United States Secretary of State]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[Siege of Vicksburg]] begins.
*[[1896]] &ndash; The [[United States Supreme Court]] rules in ''[[Plessy v. Ferguson]]'' that the "[[separate but equal]]" doctrine is constitutional.
*  1896   &ndash; [[Khodynka Tragedy]]: A [[mass panic]] on [[Khodynka Field]] in Moscow during the festivities of the [[coronation]] of [[Nicholas II of Russia|Russian Tsar Nicholas II]] results in the deaths of 1,389 people.
*[[1900]] &ndash; The United Kingdom proclaims a [[protectorate]] over [[Tonga]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; The Earth passes through the tail of [[Comet Halley]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; The first [[Cinema of India|Indian film]], ''Shree Pundalik'' by [[Dadasaheb Torne]] is released in [[Mumbai]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: The [[Selective Service Act of 1917]] is passed, giving the [[President of the United States]] the power of [[conscription]].
*[[1926]] &ndash; [[Evangelism|Evangelist]] [[Aimee Semple McPherson]] disappears while visiting a [[Venice, California]] beach.
*[[1927]] &ndash; The [[Bath School disaster]]: forty-five people are killed by bombs planted by a disgruntled school-board member in [[Michigan]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; After being founded for 20 years, the Government of the [[Republic of China (1912–49)|Republic of China]] approves [[Tongji University]] to be among the first national universities of the Republic of China.
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[New Deal]]: President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] signs an act creating the [[Tennessee Valley Authority]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Battle of Monte Cassino]] &ndash; Conclusion after seven days of the fourth battle as [[Fallschirmjäger (World War II)|German paratroopers]] evacuate [[Monte Cassino]].
*1944 &ndash; Deportation of [[Crimean Tatars]] by the [[Soviet Union]] government.
*[[1948]] &ndash; The First [[Legislative Yuan]] of the [[Republic of China (1912–49)|Republic of China]] officially convenes in [[Nanking]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Jacqueline Cochran|Jackie Cochran]] becomes the first woman to break the [[sound barrier]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; [[Operation Passage to Freedom]], the evacuation of 310,000 [[Vietnamese people|Vietnamese]] civilians, soldiers and non-Vietnamese members of the [[French Union|French]] Army from communist [[North Vietnam]] to [[South Vietnam]] following the end of the [[First Indochina War]], ends.
*[[1956]] &ndash; First ascent of [[Lhotse]] 8,516 meters, by a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] team.
*[[1958]] &ndash; An [[F-104 Starfighter]] sets a [[Flight airspeed record|world speed record]] of 1,404.19&nbsp;mph (2,259.82&nbsp;km/h).
*[[1959]] &ndash; Launch of the [[National Liberation Committee of Côte d'Ivoire]] in [[Conakry]], [[Guinea]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; Israeli spy [[Eli Cohen]] was hanged in [[Damascus]], [[Syria]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Apollo program]]: ''[[Apollo 10]]'' is launched.
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Nuclear test]]: under project [[Smiling Buddha]], India successfully detonates its first [[nuclear weapon]] becoming the sixth nation to do so.
*  1974   &ndash; Completion of the [[Warsaw radio mast]], the tallest construction ever built at the time. It collapsed on [[August 8]], [[1991]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[1980 eruption of Mount St. Helens]]: [[Mount St. Helens]] erupts in [[Washington (state)|Washington]], United States, killing 57 people and causing $3&nbsp;billion in damage.
*  1980   &ndash; [[Gwangju Massacre]]: students in [[Gwangju]], South Korea begin demonstrations calling for democratic reforms.
*[[1983]] &ndash; In [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]], the government launches a crackdown, with the leading Dublin pirate [[Radio Nova (Ireland)|Radio Nova]] being put off the air.
*[[1990]] &ndash; In France, a modified [[TGV]] train achieves a new [[Land speed record for rail vehicles|rail world speed record]] of [[TGV world speed record|515.3&nbsp;km/h]] (320.2&nbsp;mph).
*[[1991]] &ndash; Northern [[Somalia]] declares independence from the rest of Somalia as the [[Republic of Somaliland]] but is not recognized by the international community.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[European Union|EU]] - riots in [[Nørrebro]], [[Copenhagen]] caused by the approval of the four Danish exceptions in the [[Danish Maastricht Treaty referendum, 1993#Riots|Maastricht Treaty referendum]]. Police opened fire against civilians for the first time since [[World War II]] and injured 11 demonstrators. In total 113 bullets are fired.
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Shawn Nelson]], 35, steals a tank from a National Guard Armory in [[San Diego]], destroying cars and other property and is shot to death by police after immobilizing the tank.
*[[2005]] &ndash; A second photo from the [[Hubble Space Telescope]] confirms that [[Pluto]] has two additional moons, [[Nix (moon)|Nix]] and [[Hydra (moon)|Hydra]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; The post [[2006 democracy movement in Nepal|Loktantra Andolan]] government passes a landmark bill curtailing the power of the [[Kingdom of Nepal|monarchy]] and making [[Nepal]] a secular country.
*[[2009]] &ndash; [[Sri Lankan Civil War]]: The [[Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam|LTTE]] are defeated by the [[Government of Sri Lanka|Sri Lankan government]], ending almost 26 years of fighting between the two sides.
*[[2011]] &ndash; 22 people are killed when [[Sol Líneas Aéreas Flight 5428]] crashes in southern [[Argentina]].
